locutie.beschrijving: A systematic exposition of the person and work of the Holy Spirit based on the Upper Room Discourse, structured around three questions: Who is the Spirit? What does He do? How to receive Him?
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Detailed attention to Greek nuances (allos vs. heteros) and the legal metaphor of 'parakletos'.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily teaching and explaining (Asserting), transitioning into a defense of the believer's standing before God (Declaring) and a call to selflessness (Commanding).
voorbeelden: I will tell you why he is the ultimate friend.
The Holy Spirit is referred to as a person.
I demand you accept them, you love them, you acquit them (Jesus as Advocate).

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from a 'technique-based' view of the Spirit to a relational 'melted' awe; to provide assurance of salvation through the 'infallible case' of Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: High. The sermon explicitly discusses the Spirit's role in illumination and internal testimony.

voorbeelden: The Holy Spirit is referred to as a person.
In Greek, there are two words that can be translated another.
This is the teaching of the Trinity.
Stop thinking about yourself all the time.
Stop your self-assertion.
Obey him.
I must admit, I found this confusing.
I almost hate to have only one passage.
I remember when I read that, I suddenly realized...
He will never let you alone.
He will make you all that God wants you to be.
The justice of God demands that he love me forever.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological grounding, but often phrased as descriptions of God's character rather than direct 'I promise you' address.

voorbeelden: Therefore, I demand you accept them, you love them, you acquit them.
You are free. The trial is over.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher uses the authority of the 'First Advocate' to declare the hearer's status, though it remains somewhat embedded in a narrative about Jesus.

indicatoren: Long historical anecdotes (Jonathan Edwards, Charles Hodge).
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a theological lecture rather than a participant in a divine encounter for the first two-thirds of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Direct sacramental address ('I tell you today...')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' is delayed until the final section where the 'First Advocate's' work is applied.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological depth, but often mediated through the story of Charles Hodge.
voorbeelden: The justice of God demands that he love me forever.
He will never let you alone.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct questions ('Have you been melted?') and final imperatives.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the Spirit, the Father, and historical figures.

actueel_present.gebruik: Application and the 'now' of the Spirit's work.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (Who the Spirit is) to Declarative (The work of the First Advocate) to Directive (Obey).
voorbeelden: The transition from the legal case of Christ (Declarative) to the call to stop self-centeredness (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The 'Promise' (Toezegging) is the pivot that makes the final imperatives non-legalistic.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because you have the infallible case... stop your self-assertion.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a high constative volume, the sermon successfully pivots into a performative event by using the 'Advocate' metaphor to declare a new reality for the hearer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I am not asking for mercy; I am asking for justice.
sterke_punten.effect: Changes the hearer's ontological standing before God.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: In Greek, there are two words that can be translated another...

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it moves from 'talking about' the Spirit to 'proclaiming' the legal acquittal won by Christ.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of the 'First Advocate' section functions as a word-sacrament of assurance.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicit. The preacher acts as a herald of the 'Advocate's' case.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Strongly evident in the final application.
tekstueel_bewijs: The second Advocate is talking to you about it.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the 'melting' of the heart is attributed to the Spirit.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit actually brings God to you.

sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Present in the description of the 'blazing, brilliant heart'.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'The Spirit is...' (3rd person assertive) to 'The Spirit comes to you now...' (2nd person commissive) earlier in the text.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Holy Spirit is referred to as a person.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The Holy Spirit stands before you today as a Person, not a force.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a grammatical fact to a present encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often framed as a quote from Charles Hodge.
voorbeeldzinnen: I declare to you: Christ has paid, and God's justice is now your shield.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Maintain the strong 'you' focus of the final third.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: The balance is already a strength of this text.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in moving from systematic theology to performative proclamation. The 'Advocate' section is a powerful illocutionary act.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (anecdotes); SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the Gospel to change the hearer's status.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to persuade; this sermon seeks to 'acquit' (a legal, performative act).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power isn't in the Greek word study, but in the Commissive act of promising God's justice to the sinner.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I am not asking for mercy; I am asking for justice.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Theological turning point of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Advocate' metaphor to bridge the gap between information and event.
